title: The Best Way To Get Your Kids To Eat Their Vegetables
summary: Kids associate vegetables with being told to do something and not having the freedom to choose when or how much to eat them. This causes them to resent eating them, which makes them not want to eat. Kids also dislike vegetables because they arenâ€™t prepared in ways that are enjoyable for them. Add Spirulina and Chlorella are two types of algae that are rich in minerals, vitamins and many other nutrients that your body needs. Add fruit to the top of your green smoothie, it will bleed into the green colour. If you want your smoothie to look green, add the greens to the bottom of the blender.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Why Kids Don\u2019t Like Veggies"),mdx("p",null,`Kids are not born disliking vegetables. In fact, they are born loving them. It\u2019s only after years of hearing \u201Ceat your veggies\u201D that they start to resent eating them. This happens for a few reasons. Kids associate vegetables with being told to do something and not having the freedom to choose when or how much to eat them. This causes them to resent eating them, which makes them not want to eat them.
Kids also dislike vegetables because they aren\u2019t prepared in ways that are enjoyable for them. You can\u2019t just feed them raw broccoli and expect them to love it. They need to be presented in a way that gets them excited about eating them. This means finding ways to prepare vegetables that are both tasty and enjoyable for them to eat.`),mdx("h2",null,"How to Make a Green Smoothie for Your Kid"),mdx("p",null,"Once you\u2019ve chosen which ingredients you want to put into your green smoothie, the next step is to blend them up. If you have a blender with a large capacity, use it, but keep in mind that you may need to chop up some of your ingredients if they\u2019re too big. If you have a smaller blender, use a food processor or hand blender."),mdx("p",null,"Once your smoothie is blended, pour it into a bowl and add in any toppings you want like crumbled cookies, granola, nuts, seeds, dried fruit or coconut flakes. This will give your smoothie a fun appearance that kids will want to eat."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Spirulina and Chlorella"),mdx("p",null,"Spirulina and chlorella are two types of algae that are rich in minerals, vitamins and many other nutrients that your body needs. These algae also contain protein, which makes them a great addition to a green smoothie that kids will want to drink."),mdx("p",null,"If a smoothie isn\u2019t appealing to your child, adding a scoop of spirulina or chlorella powder to their favourite food is another way to add this veggie boost to their diet. You can add it to oatmeal, yogurt, smoothies, pancakes, muffins, cookies and more."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Fruit"),mdx("p",null,"Fruits like berries, apples, oranges, mangoes and bananas are loaded with vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. These delicious fruits are the perfect way to get your kids excited about eating their vegetables."),mdx("p",null,"If you add fruit to the top of your green smoothie, it will bleed into the green colour. This turns your smoothie into a purple smoothie that kids may not want to drink. If you\u2019re adding fruit to the bottom of your smoothie, your drink will be green. If you\u2019re adding fruit to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend it until it\u2019s liquefied so it doesn\u2019t leave chunks at the top of the glass."),mdx("h2",null,"Add Dark Leafy Greens"),mdx("p",null,"Kale, spinach, Swiss chard and other dark leafy greens are packed with vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. These are the perfect ingredients to add to a green smoothie that will help kids get all the nutrients they need without even knowing it."),mdx("p",null,"If you choose to add these greens to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend them until they\u2019re liquefied so there are no chunks left behind. If you want your smoothie to look green, add the greens to the bottom of the blender so they don\u2019t get blended up."),mdx("h2",null,"Adding Hidden Veggies: Broccoli, Spinach, Beets and more."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to give your kids a nutritious boost but don\u2019t want them to know they\u2019re drinking their veggies, here are some good ingredients to add to your green smoothie: broccoli, spinach, radishes, beets, carrots and bell peppers."),mdx("p",null,"These veggies blend up well in a green smoothie and you won\u2019t be able to taste them. If you\u2019re adding them to the top of your smoothie, make sure to blend them until they\u2019re liquefied and they don\u2019t leave behind any chunks. If you want your smoothie to look green, add these ingredients to the bottom of the blender."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Creating the perfect green smoothie for your kid isn\u2019t difficult if you know what to put in it. The trick is to put nutritious ingredients into a drink that kids will love. This will get them excited about drinking their veggies, which will help them get the nutrients they need."),mdx("p",null,"Kids these days want sugar and flavour in everything they eat. If you can find a way to sneak nutrients into their favourite drinks and foods, you\u2019ll be doing them a favour and helping them grow up to be healthy adults."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 7 Exercises to Lose Weight in 7 Days

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The beginning of the New Year is a perfect time to focus on healthy habits and get off to a great start. With a strict diet, you will be able to burn fat effectively and efficiently, leading to weight loss in just a week. Exercising regularly not only helps you lose weight but also promotes long-term weight loss by increasing your metabolic rate and maintaining lean body mass.
Reducing fat from the body requires breaking down of fats in the body through physical activities. There are undoubtedly many reasons why people fail at losing weight, but most of them boil down to three simple things: lack of time, motivation, or knowledge. Fortunately, with these simple tricks you can lose weight in 7 days:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get in Shape for Summer - Tips for Every Fitness Level

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When summer rolls around, everyone seems to want to look their best. After all, it\u2019s the season of tank tops, swimsuits, and short shorts. The problem is that not everyone hits the gym year-round or has access to a gym that fits their needs. If you tend to slack on your fitness game once the snow begins falling and leaves start falling from the trees again, now is the time to start making changes so that you\u2019re ready for summer.
Whether you\u2019re looking for ways to get back in shape after a long winter hibernation or just hoping to avoid ending up in an unflattering bathing suit this summer, hitting the gym as often as possible is essential. But what if you don\u2019t have a gym membership? Or what if you can only commit to working out at home? Luckily we have some great tips for how you can get in shape for summer no matter where you are.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Cut Sugar from Your Diet

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In recent years, sugar has received a lot of negative attention. From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Make a Workout Fun, Even If You Hate Working Out

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The unfortunate reality is that not everyone loves working out, and many people struggle to find activities they enjoy enough to continue on a regular basis. Some people hate it because of the physical discomfort, others because it\u2019s boring and feels like a chore, and for even more it\u2019s simply harder than they expected. . . Fortunately, there are plenty of ways to make your next workout fun again. Even if you hate exercising. Even if you feel unmotivated and drained every time you try. Working out doesn\u2019t have to be something you dread or look forward to only once in awhile. You just need the right strategies and techniques, which we\u2019ve outlined below as our top 10 ways to make a workout fun again, no matter how much you hate working out!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Exercises You Can Do at Home and save a Ton of Money

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Who says working out has to be expensive? You can do it anywhere and anytime. There are various affordable home workout videos available on the internet as well. However, that doesn\u2019t mean you have to break the bank when trying to save money in other areas of your life. Those at-home videos might seem like your only cheap option, but there are plenty of ways you can cut down on costs while still getting the same benefits from working out at home.
Instead of splurging on a one-time membership or an expensive series of DVDs, why not invest in some home equipment that won\u2019t cost you a fortune, but will help you get in great shape? Working out at home also has its advantages: no traffic jams and no gym membership fees! Here are 10 cheap home workout ideas for anyone who wants to slim down and tone up without breaking their budget.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Get Moving When You Don't Feel like It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year\u2019s resolutions are the perfect time to start fresh, refocus our efforts, and commit to a healthier lifestyle. Many of us make the common resolution to exercise more. However, that can be easier said than done for some people. If you don\u2019t feel like working out one day, it doesn\u2019t mean you stop going to the gym or just give up entirely. It means you have to come up with creative ways to stay motivated and get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it.
Exercising is not always fun, but we need it to remain healthy and fit. While some people love sweating in their favorite gym class, others avoid workouts because they know how much they hate them. While exercise can be difficult at times, there are lots of different ways you can make moving more fun so that it becomes second nature and something you no longer dread.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Choices When Eating Out

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You\u2019ve probably heard it before: When you\u2019re busy, you need healthy snacks to keep you going. The problem is that it\u2019s not always easy to find healthy snacks that are also fast and convenient. In our hectic, on-the-go world, most of us don\u2019t have time to sit down for a healthy meal three times a day. Instead, we\u2019re often forced to make snap decisions about what we can eat quickly and conveniently. Unfortunately, those decisions too often lead to less than healthy snack options like potato chips or sweets. However, there are plenty of great ways to get your recommended daily intake of fruits and veggies even when you\u2019re on the go. These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go are perfect for keeping in your purse, desk drawer, locker, or anywhere else you might find yourself hungry and without access to a full meal."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
